word_mean: 器官的，器质的：与器官有关的

sentence.Network_en: Today's organic wine producer is typically a small, quality-conscious family concern.

means.word_mean: 器官的,有条理的,整齐的,整洁的
构造的,天然的,必要的,基本的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek organikos 'relating to an organ or instrument'

encyclopedia.content: organic有机的词意 organic 英音：[ɔ:'gænik] 美音：[ɔr'gænɪk] 形容词 a. [Z] 1. 器官的[B] 2. 有机体的，生物的[B] organic evolution 生物进化 3. 【化】有机的[B] organic chemistry 有机化学 4. 构成整体所必需的 an organic whole 有机的整体 5. 组织的，建制的，基本的 the organic law 基本法 6. 施用有机肥料的 7. 【医】组织结构的，器质的Organic有机植物 与—般种植

entry.tran: 有机的；绿色的；无农害的；不使用化肥的
entry.def: Organic methods of farming and gardening use only natural animal and plant products to help the plants or animals grow and be healthy, rather than using chemicals.

example.tran: 有机农业正在各地迅速发展起来。

entry.def: Organic substances are of the sort produced by or found in living things.

example.ex: Incorporating organic material into chalky soils will reduce the alkalinity.
example.tran: 在白垩质土壤中添加有机物可降低其碱性。

entry.tran: （变化或发展）逐渐的，自然的，演进的
entry.def: Organic change or development happens gradually and naturally rather than suddenly.

example.ex: ...to manage the company and supervise its organic growth.
example.tran: 经营公司并指导其逐步发展

entry.tran: （社群或结构）有机的，统一的，不可分割的
entry.def: If a community or structure is an organic whole, each part of it is necessary and fits well with the other parts.

example.ex: City planning treats the city as a unit, as an organic whole.
example.tran: 城市规划将城市视为一个单位，一个有机的整体。

means.word_mean: 1. a fertilizer that is derived from animal or vegetable matter
1. relating or belonging to the class of chemical compounds having a carbon basis;
2. of or relating to or derived from living organisms;
3. being or relating to or derived from or having properties characteristic of living organisms;
4. involving or affecting physiology or bodily organs;
5. of or relating to foodstuff grown or raised without synthetic fertilizers or pesticides or hormones;
6. simple and healthful and close to nature;
7. constitutional in the structure of something (especially your physical makeup)

stems_affixes.word_buile: in无+organic[adj.器官的, 有机的, 组织的]→adj.无生物的, 无机的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器官的, 有机的, 组织的
stems_affixes.word_buile: organ[ n.器官;风琴;机构]+ic……的→adj.器官的, 有机的, 组织的
organ器官,工具→ n.器官;风琴;机构
organ器官,工具+ism性质→n.生物体, 有机体
organize[v.组织, 使有机化, 给予生机 v.组织起来]→ v.组织

stems_affixes.value_cn: 组织, 使有机化, 给予生机
stems_affixes.word_buile: organ器官;机构+ize……化→v.组织, 使有机化, 给予生机 v.组织起来

Sentence.sentence: They weren't looking for cured meats, organic produce or beautiful presentation; they were looking for whatever they could get their hands on, and this prioritisation of quantity over quality prevailed for decades, meaning a generation was brought up with food that couldn't compete with neighbouring France, Italy, Belgium or Spain.
It has excellent organic farms, beautifully crafted cheeses, high-quality meats
They are produced on excellent organic farms.
Usually when we walk through the rain forest we hear a soft sound from all the moist leaves and organic debris on the forest floor," says ecologist Daniel Nepstad.
organic debris echoes the sounds in a rain forest

sentences.en: There is nothing organic wrong with you.

means.word_mean: 有机(体)的, 有机物的

jushi.chinese: 有机化合物构成生命的基础。

jushi.english: There is nothing organic wrong with you.
